item.title: Python and Databases on the 22th of May 2014
item.description:
Slides/Presentation from last Thrusday Meetup are available in this post.

We would like to take this opportunity to thank again our speakers for the hardwork and their great presentation.

1) Introducción a SQLAlchemy


Speaker: Jorge Medina

Introducción a SQLAlchemy, good overview of what an ORM is and how SQLAlchemy can simplify your life when working with database.

Python BCN Introduction to SQLAlchemy from theManda

Introduction to #SqlAlchemy by Jorge Medina at @pybcn pic.twitter.com/oWOZx9JLkG

— Areski Belaid (@areskib) May 22, 2014



2) Python with MySQL

Speaker: Miquel Camprodon

An Introduction to Mysql, how to install and configure it. Discover how to query and connect to a MySQL database from Python. Mysqldb wrapper for Mysql, how to use it.

BCNPythonMeetup_20140522_Python&MySQL from miquelcm

Python & Mysql introduction presented by Miquel Camprodon at @pybcn pic.twitter.com/8waAHe2DaD

— Areski Belaid (@areskib) May 22, 2014



3) MongoDB

Speaker: Javier Arias

Python and MongoDB via pymongo. Introduction to MongoDB, document oriented storage, overview of how to work with mongoDB from Python.

You can find the content of the presentation here: https://gist.github.com/javierarilos/015e2ce27cecdea63564

Python and MongoDB, by Javier Arias (@javier_arilos) #pybcn pic.twitter.com/lpfiecOCHq

— Python Barcelona (@pybcn) May 22, 2014

item.title: Python and Sciences on the 24th of April 2014
item.description:
Please find bellow the slides of each of the speakers:

1) IPython & Notebook


Speaker: Loris Mularoni

Introduction to Ipython Notebook - a web-based interactive computational environment

Github: https://github.com/batterio/intro_ipython_notebook

For visioning the code people can also use the nbviewer website:

http://nbviewer.ipython.org/github/batterio/intro_ipython_notebook/blob/master/notebooks/index.ipynb

The latter link is pretty cool because it lets you exploring the code without the need of downloading it nor installing the ipython notebook.

Introduction to IPython Notebook, by Loris Mularoni (@LorisMularoni) #pybcn pic.twitter.com/ZxvSS7SDgE

— Python Barcelona (@pybcn) April 24, 2014



2) Introduction to Python for Data analysis

An Introduction to Python for Data analysis: numpy, scipy and pandas

Pandas is an open source, BSD-licensed library providing high-performance, easy-to-use data structures and data analysis tools for the Python programming language.
